title: Terminal dock-spawn animation from navbar
description:
Animate the 8 Claude Code terminals to "spawn" from the navbar center like macOS dock window launches.

## ðŸ”§ Global Orchestration (REQUIRED)

All scroll animations MUST use the global Lenis + GSAP orchestration from `main.js`:

```javascript
// Access the shared instances - DO NOT create new ones
const { lenis, ScrollTrigger, gsap } = window.ChrisTheme;

// Create scene-specific JS file: themes/chris-theme/assets/js/scenes/terminal-spawn.js
```

**DO NOT:** Create separate Lenis instances, import GSAP separately, or use raw RAF loops.
**DO:** Access everything via `window.ChrisTheme`, let main.js handle the RAF loop.

## Animation Style
Like macOS windows opening from the dock:
- Start: scale(0.1) at navbar center (viewport horizontal center, navbar Y)
- End: scale(1.0) at final grid position
- Easing: elastic/spring for natural "pop" feel
- Duration: 400-500ms per terminal

## Trigger Model: Scroll-TRIGGERED, NOT Scroll-SCRUBBED

| Aspect | Behavior |
|--------|----------|
| What scroll controls | WHEN each terminal starts spawning |
| What scroll does NOT control | Animation progress (runs to completion) |
| Can pause mid-spawn? | NO - individual animations are atomic |
| Can pause between spawns? | YES - e.g., 3 spawned, scroll more â†’ 5 more |

## Spawn Choreography
```
Scroll 0-12.5%   â†’ Terminal 1 triggers
Scroll 12.5-25%  â†’ Terminal 2 triggers
Scroll 25-37.5%  â†’ Terminal 3 triggers
Scroll 37.5-50%  â†’ Terminal 4 triggers
Scroll 50-62.5%  â†’ Terminal 5 triggers
Scroll 62.5-75%  â†’ Terminal 6 triggers
Scroll 75-87.5%  â†’ Terminal 7 triggers
Scroll 87.5-100% â†’ Terminal 8 triggers
```

Natural cascade: previous spawn ~70% complete when next triggers.

## Animation Keyframes (per terminal)
```javascript
const { gsap, ScrollTrigger } = window.ChrisTheme;

gsap.fromTo(terminal, {
  scale: 0.1,
  x: navbarCenterX - terminalFinalX,
  y: navbarY - terminalFinalY,
  opacity: 0
}, {
  scale: 1.0,
  x: 0,
  y: 0,
  opacity: 1,
  duration: 0.45,
  ease: 'elastic.out(1, 0.5)'
});
```

## Implementation
1. ScrollTrigger onUpdate tracks scroll progress
2. Calculate which terminals should have triggered
3. For each newly-triggered terminal, fire GSAP animation
4. Track spawned state to prevent re-triggering
5. Reverse scroll: terminals should NOT un-spawn (stay visible)

## Navbar Center Calculation
```javascript
const navbarCenterX = window.innerWidth / 2;
const navbarY = document.querySelector('.header').getBoundingClientRect().bottom;
```

## Motion Principles
- Transform (scale + translate)
- Stagger (sequential triggering)
- Easing (elastic spring)

## Acceptance
- [ ] Uses `window.ChrisTheme.gsap` and `window.ChrisTheme.ScrollTrigger`
- [ ] Terminals spawn from navbar center (not their final position)
- [ ] Scale animation: 0.1 â†’ 1.0 with elastic easing
- [ ] Translate animation: navbar â†’ grid position
- [ ] Individual spawn animations complete fully (not interruptible)
- [ ] User can pause between spawns (e.g., 3 visible, then scroll for more)
- [ ] All 8 terminals visible at 100% scroll progress
- [ ] Reverse scroll: terminals stay visible (don't un-spawn)
- [ ] Mobile: same behavior, appropriate for touch scrolling
- [ ] Reduced motion: terminals appear immediately, no animation
close_reason: Implementation complete. Animation works independently - dependency on cog is visual sequencing, not code. Terminals spawn from navbar with elastic easing.

# Windswept + Captured Scroll Footer Showcase

Cinematic footer section showcasing blog scroll capture with ambient windswept background.

## Visual Concept
- **Foreground**: Captured scroll video (blog posts scrolling) - full bleed
- **Background**: Windswept sand dune video - visible through blend/transparency
- **Effect**: Creates atmospheric, premium showcase of content

## Compression Requirements (CRITICAL)
Both videos must be ultra-compressed while maintaining high quality:

### Target Specs:
| Metric | Target |
|--------|--------|
| File size | < 2MB per video (total < 4MB) |
| Quality | CRF 28-30 (vs current CRF 18) |
| Resolution | 1920x1080 (desktop), scaled for mobile |
| Format | H.264 + WebM fallback (VP9) |
| Bitrate | ~1-2 Mbps max |

### Encoding Command (optimized):
```bash
# Two-pass H.264 for optimal compression
ffmpeg -i input.mp4 -c:v libx264 -preset veryslow -crf 28 \
  -vf "scale=1920:-2" -pix_fmt yuv420p \
  -movflags +faststart output.mp4

# WebM fallback (better compression)
ffmpeg -i input.mp4 -c:v libvpx-vp9 -crf 32 -b:v 0 \
  -vf "scale=1920:-2" output.webm
```

## Implementation

### HTML Structure:
```html
<section class="blog-showcase-footer">
  <video class="windswept-bg" autoplay muted loop playsinline>
    <source src="windswept.webm" type="video/webm">

  </video>
</section>
```

## ðŸ”§ Global Orchestration (REQUIRED)

All scroll animations MUST use the global Lenis + GSAP orchestration from `main.js`:

- Clip-path animates but feels mechanical
